locations.name: Carmen's Bedroom
locations.description: An elderly woman's bedroom in a colonial-style house in Villa de Leyva, Boyaca. Thick whitewashed adobe walls, dark heavy wooden ceiling beams (vigas). Large dark wooden bed with carved headboard, topped with layered wool blankets in earthy tones (brown, burgundy, cream) and a crocheted bedspread. Two fat feather pillows. Dark wooden nightstand with framed black-and-white photo of deceased husband, small statue of the Virgin Mary, rosary beads draped over statue, reading lamp, and reading glasses case. Heavy dark wooden wardrobe (armario) with carved doors. Small wooden dresser with lace doily, ceramic vase with dried flowers. Crucifix on the wall above the bed. Window with heavy wooden shutters and white lace curtains. Terra-cotta tile floor with thick wool rug (tapete) in warm tones. The black cat Negrito often sleeps curled at the foot of the bed.

small Virgin Mary statue with rosary
thick wool rug in warm tones
dresser with lace doily and dried flowers
Negrito the black cat on bed

locations.name: Carmen's Bathroom
locations.description: A simple but clean bathroom in a colonial house. White tile walls with a decorative blue-and-white tile border (azulejos) at waist height — traditional Colombian colonial style. Single pedestal sink with a mirror above. Toilet. Small shower area with a plastic curtain (no bathtub). Metal grab bars installed beside the toilet and in the shower for safety. White towels and a floral hand towel hanging on a rack. Small wooden shelf with soap, shampoo, a ceramic dish for bar soap, and a cup with denture care supplies. Small woven basket with toiletries. Terra-cotta tile floor with a rubber non-slip bath mat. A small wooden stool for sitting. Simple overhead light fixture.
key_features: white tile walls with blue-and-white azulejo border
small shower area with plastic curtain
ceramic soap dish with bar soap

locations.name: Artisan Workshop and Courtyard
locations.description: The heart of Carmen's colonial house — a sun-dappled interior courtyard (patio) with an attached covered workshop area (corredor). The courtyard has a stone floor with potted plants everywhere: geraniums, begonias, ferns, herbs (cilantro, oregano, mint). A small stone fountain in the center (non-working, used as a planter now). Whitewashed walls with climbing bougainvillea (purple and orange). Wooden columns support the corredor roof with clay roof tiles. The workshop area under the corredor has: a traditional backstrap loom (telar de cintura) set up with a half-finished woven textile in red, orange, and cream, a small pottery wheel on a sturdy wooden table, shelves with finished pottery pieces (bowls, vases, cups) in terra-cotta and painted designs, baskets of colored wool yarn, and a wooden rocking chair. A small wooden table with two chairs for outdoor meals or coffee. The cats wander freely — Canela suns herself on the warm stones, Michi plays with yarn scraps, Negrito naps under the rocking chair.
